data.name: سُورَةُ الدُّخَانِ
data.englishBism: In the name of God, The Most Gracious, The Dispenser of Grace

ayahs.englishText: Ha. Mim.
ayahs.arabicText: حم

ayahs.englishText: CONSIDER this divine writ, clear in itself and clearly showing the truth!
ayahs.arabicText: وَالْكِتَابِ الْمُبِينِ

ayahs.englishText: Behold, from on high have We bestowed it on a blessed night: for, verily, We have always been warning [man].
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّا أَنْزَلْنَاهُ فِي لَيْلَةٍ مُبَارَكَةٍ ۚ إِنَّا كُنَّا مُنْذِرِينَ

ayahs.englishText: On that [night] was made clear, in wisdom, the distinction between all things [good and evil]
ayahs.arabicText: فِيهَا يُفْرَقُ كُلُّ أَمْرٍ حَكِيمٍ

ayahs.englishText: at a behest from Ourselves: for, verily, We have always been sending [Our messages of guidance]
ayahs.arabicText: أَمْرًا مِنْ عِنْدِنَا ۚ إِنَّا كُنَّا مُرْسِلِينَ

ayahs.englishText: in pur­suance of thy Sustainer’s grace [unto man]. Verily, He alone is all-hearing, all-knowing,
ayahs.arabicText: رَحْمَةً مِنْ رَبِّكَ ۚ إِنَّهُ هُوَ السَّمِيعُ الْعَلِيمُ

ayahs.englishText: the Sustainer of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them - if you could but grasp it with inner certainty!
ayahs.arabicText: رَبِّ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا ۖ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ مُوقِنِينَ

ayahs.englishText: There is no deity save Him: He grants life and deals death: He is your Sustainer as well as the Sustainer of your forebears of old.
ayahs.arabicText: لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ يُحْيِي وَيُمِيتُ ۖ رَبُّكُمْ وَرَبُّ آبَائِكُمُ الْأَوَّلِينَ

ayahs.englishText: Nay, but they [who lack inner certainty] are but Dying with their doubts.
ayahs.arabicText: بَلْ هُمْ فِي شَكٍّ يَلْعَبُونَ

ayahs.englishText: WAIT, THEN, for the Day when the skies shall bring forth a pall of smoke which will make obvious [the approach of the Last Hour],
ayahs.arabicText: فَارْتَقِبْ يَوْمَ تَأْتِي السَّمَاءُ بِدُخَانٍ مُبِينٍ

ayahs.englishText: enveloping all mankind, [and causing the sinners to exclaim:] “Grievous is this suffering!
ayahs.arabicText: يَغْشَى النَّاسَ ۖ هَٰذَا عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ

ayahs.englishText: O our Sustainer, relieve us of suffering, for, verily, we [now] believe [in Thee]!”
ayahs.arabicText: رَبَّنَا اكْشِفْ عَنَّا الْعَذَابَ إِنَّا مُؤْمِنُونَ

ayahs.englishText: [But] how shall this remembrance avail them [at the Last Hour], seeing that an apostle had pre­viously come unto them, clearly expounding the truth,
ayahs.arabicText: أَنَّىٰ لَهُمُ الذِّكْرَىٰ وَقَدْ جَاءَهُمْ رَسُولٌ مُبِينٌ

ayahs.englishText: whereupon they turned their backs on him and said, “Taught [by others] is he, a madman”?
ayahs.arabicText: ثُمَّ تَوَلَّوْا عَنْهُ وَقَالُوا مُعَلَّمٌ مَجْنُونٌ

ayahs.englishText: [Still,] behold, We shall postpone this suffer­ing for a little while, although you are bound to revert [to your evil ways: but]
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّا كَاشِفُو الْعَذَابِ قَلِيلًا ۚ إِنَّكُمْ عَائِدُونَ

ayahs.englishText: on the Day when We shall seize [all sinners] with a most mighty onslaught, We shall, verily, inflict Our retribution [on you as well]!
ayahs.arabicText: يَوْمَ نَبْطِشُ الْبَطْشَةَ الْكُبْرَىٰ إِنَّا مُنْتَقِمُونَ

ayahs.englishText: AND, INDEED, [long] before their time did We try Pharaoh’s people [in the same way]: for there came unto them a noble apostle, [who said:]
ayahs.arabicText: ۞ وَلَقَدْ فَتَنَّا قَبْلَهُمْ قَوْمَ فِرْعَوْنَ وَجَاءَهُمْ رَسُولٌ كَرِيمٌ

ayahs.englishText: “Give in unto me, O God’s bondmen! Verily, I am an apostle [sent] unto you, worthy of trust!
ayahs.arabicText: أَنْ أَدُّوا إِلَيَّ عِبَادَ اللَّهِ ۖ إِنِّي لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌ

ayahs.englishText: “And exalt not yourselves against God: for, verily, I come unto you with a manifest authority [from Him];
ayahs.arabicText: وَأَنْ لَا تَعْلُوا عَلَى اللَّهِ ۖ إِنِّي آتِيكُمْ بِسُلْطَانٍ مُبِينٍ

ayahs.englishText: and, behold, it is with my Sustainer - and your Sustainer - that I seek refuge against all your endeavours to revile me.
ayahs.arabicText: وَإِنِّي عُذْتُ بِرَبِّي وَرَبِّكُمْ أَنْ تَرْجُمُونِ

ayahs.englishText: And if you do not believe me, [at least] stand away from me!”
ayahs.arabicText: وَإِنْ لَمْ تُؤْمِنُوا لِي فَاعْتَزِلُونِ

ayahs.englishText: But then, [when they beset him with their enmity,] he called out to his Sustainer, “These are [indeed] people lost in sin!”
ayahs.arabicText: فَدَعَا رَبَّهُ أَنَّ هَٰؤُلَاءِ قَوْمٌ مُجْرِمُونَ

ayahs.englishText: And [God said]: “Go thou forth with My servants by night, for you will surely be pursued;
ayahs.arabicText: فَأَسْرِ بِعِبَادِي لَيْلًا إِنَّكُمْ مُتَّبَعُونَ

ayahs.englishText: and leave the sea becalmed [between thee and Pharaoh’s men]: for, verily, they are a host destined to be drowned!”
ayahs.arabicText: وَاتْرُكِ الْبَحْرَ رَهْوًا ۖ إِنَّهُمْ جُنْدٌ مُغْرَقُونَ

ayahs.englishText: [And so they perished: and] how many gardens did they leave behind, and water-runnels,
ayahs.arabicText: كَمْ تَرَكُوا مِنْ جَنَّاتٍ وَعُيُونٍ

ayahs.englishText: and fields of grain, and noble dwellings,
ayahs.arabicText: وَزُرُوعٍ وَمَقَامٍ كَرِيمٍ

ayahs.englishText: and [all that] life of ease in which they used to delight!
ayahs.arabicText: وَنَعْمَةٍ كَانُوا فِيهَا فَاكِهِينَ

ayahs.englishText: Thus it was. And [then] We made another people heirs [to what they had left],
ayahs.arabicText: كَذَٰلِكَ ۖ وَأَوْرَثْنَاهَا قَوْمًا آخَرِينَ

ayahs.englishText: and neither sky nor earth shed tears over them, nor were they allowed a respite.
ayahs.arabicText: فَمَا بَكَتْ عَلَيْهِمُ السَّمَاءُ وَالْأَرْضُ وَمَا كَانُوا مُنْظَرِينَ

ayahs.englishText: And, indeed, We delivered the children of Israel from the shameful suffering
ayahs.arabicText: وَلَقَدْ نَجَّيْنَا بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ مِنَ الْعَذَابِ الْمُهِينِ

ayahs.englishText: [inflicted on them] by Pharaoh, seeing that he was truly outstand­ing among those who waste their own selves;
ayahs.arabicText: مِنْ فِرْعَوْنَ ۚ إِنَّهُ كَانَ عَالِيًا مِنَ الْمُسْرِفِينَ

ayahs.englishText: and indeed, We chose them knowingly above all other people,
ayahs.arabicText: وَلَقَدِ اخْتَرْنَاهُمْ عَلَىٰ عِلْمٍ عَلَى الْعَالَمِينَ

ayahs.englishText: and gave them such signs [of Our grace] as would clearly presage a test.
ayahs.arabicText: وَآتَيْنَاهُمْ مِنَ الْآيَاتِ مَا فِيهِ بَلَاءٌ مُبِينٌ

ayahs.englishText: [Now,] behold, these [people] say indeed:
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّ هَٰؤُلَاءِ لَيَقُولُونَ

ayahs.englishText: “That [which is ahead of us] is but our first [and only] death, and we shall not be raised to life again.
ayahs.arabicText: إِنْ هِيَ إِلَّا مَوْتَتُنَا الْأُولَىٰ وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمُنْشَرِينَ

ayahs.englishText: So then, bring forth our forefathers [as witnesses], if what you claim is true!”
ayahs.arabicText: فَأْتُوا بِآبَائِنَا إِنْ كُنْتُمْ صَادِقِينَ

ayahs.englishText: Are they, then, better than the people of Tubba and those before them, whom We destroyed because they were truly lost in [the same] sin?
ayahs.arabicText: أَهُمْ خَيْرٌ أَمْ قَوْمُ تُبَّعٍ وَالَّذِينَ مِنْ قَبْلِهِمْ ۚ أَهْلَكْنَاهُمْ ۖ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا مُجْرِمِينَ

ayahs.englishText: For [thus it is:] We have not created the heavens and the earth and all that is between them in mere idle play:
ayahs.arabicText: وَمَا خَلَقْنَا السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا لَاعِبِينَ

ayahs.englishText: none of this have We created without [an inner] truth: but most of them under­stand it not.
ayahs.arabicText: مَا خَلَقْنَاهُمَا إِلَّا بِالْحَقِّ وَلَٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ

ayahs.englishText: VERILY, the Day of Distinction [between the true and the false] is the term appointed for all of them:
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّ يَوْمَ الْفَصْلِ مِيقَاتُهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ

ayahs.englishText: the Day when no friend shall be of the least avail to his friend, and when none shall be succoured
ayahs.arabicText: يَوْمَ لَا يُغْنِي مَوْلًى عَنْ مَوْلًى شَيْئًا وَلَا هُمْ يُنْصَرُونَ

ayahs.englishText: save those upon whom God will have bestowed His grace and mercy: for, verily, He alone is almighty, a dispenser of grace.
ayahs.arabicText: إِلَّا مَنْ رَحِمَ اللَّهُ ۚ إِنَّهُ هُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الرَّحِيمُ

ayahs.englishText: Verily, [in the life to come] the tree of deadly fruit
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّ شَجَرَتَ الزَّقُّومِ

ayahs.englishText: will be the food of the sinful:
ayahs.arabicText: طَعَامُ الْأَثِيمِ

ayahs.englishText: like molten lead will it boil in the belly,
ayahs.arabicText: كَالْمُهْلِ يَغْلِي فِي الْبُطُونِ

ayahs.englishText: like the boiling of burning despair.
ayahs.arabicText: كَغَلْيِ الْحَمِيمِ

ayahs.englishText: [And the word will be spoken:] “Seize him, [O you forces of hell,] and drag him into the midst of the blazing fire:
ayahs.arabicText: خُذُوهُ فَاعْتِلُوهُ إِلَىٰ سَوَاءِ الْجَحِيمِ

ayahs.englishText: then pour over his head the anguish of burning despair!
ayahs.arabicText: ثُمَّ صُبُّوا فَوْقَ رَأْسِهِ مِنْ عَذَابِ الْحَمِيمِ

ayahs.englishText: Taste it - thou who [on earth] hast considered thyself so mighty, so noble!
ayahs.arabicText: ذُقْ إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ الْعَزِيزُ الْكَرِيمُ

ayahs.englishText: This is the very thing which you [deniers of the truth] were wont to call in question!”
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّ هَٰذَا مَا كُنْتُمْ بِهِ تَمْتَرُونَ

ayahs.englishText: [As against this -] verily, the God-conscious will find themselves in a state secure,
ayahs.arabicText: إِنَّ الْمُتَّقِينَ فِي مَقَامٍ أَمِينٍ

ayahs.englishText: amid gardens and springs,
ayahs.arabicText: فِي جَنَّاتٍ وَعُيُونٍ

ayahs.englishText: wearing [garments] of silk and brocade, facing one another [in love].
ayahs.arabicText: يَلْبَسُونَ مِنْ سُنْدُسٍ وَإِسْتَبْرَقٍ مُتَقَابِلِينَ

ayahs.englishText: Thus shall it be. And We shall pair them with companions pure, most beautiful of eye.
ayahs.arabicText: كَذَٰلِكَ وَزَوَّجْنَاهُمْ بِحُورٍ عِينٍ

ayahs.englishText: In that [paradise] they shall [rightfully] claim all the fruits [of their past deeds], resting in security;
ayahs.arabicText: يَدْعُونَ فِيهَا بِكُلِّ فَاكِهَةٍ آمِنِينَ

ayahs.englishText: and neither shall they taste death there after having passed through their erstwhile death. Thus will He have preserved them from all suffer­ing through the blazing fire-
ayahs.arabicText: لَا يَذُوقُونَ فِيهَا الْمَوْتَ إِلَّا الْمَوْتَةَ الْأُولَىٰ ۖ وَوَقَاهُمْ عَذَابَ الْجَحِيمِ

ayahs.englishText: an act of thy Sustainer’s favour: and that, that will be the triumph supreme!
ayahs.arabicText: فَضْلًا مِنْ رَبِّكَ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ هُوَ الْفَوْزُ الْعَظِيمُ

ayahs.englishText: THUS, THEN, [O Prophet,] have We made this [divine writ] easy to understand, in thine own [human] tongue, so that men might take it to heart.
ayahs.arabicText: فَإِنَّمَا يَسَّرْنَاهُ بِلِسَانِكَ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَتَذَكَّرُونَ

ayahs.englishText: So wait thou [for what the future will bring]: behold, they, too, are waiting.
ayahs.arabicText: فَارْتَقِبْ إِنَّهُمْ مُرْتَقِبُونَ
